trans-unit.source: Steps - Raw Document to Filter Events
trans-unit.target: Steps - Raw Document to Filter Events

trans-unit.source: Raw Document to Filter Events Step
trans-unit.target: Raw Document to Filter Events Step

trans-unit.source: If you are using an Okapi Tool after the M9 release, you should be using the wiki online help: http://www.opentag.com/okapi/wiki/index.php?title=Raw_Document_to_Filter_Events_Step
trans-unit.target: If you are using an Okapi Tool after the M9 release, you should be using the wiki online help: http://www.opentag.com/okapi/wiki/index.php?title=Raw_Document_to_Filter_Events_Step

trans-unit.source: This step extracts the content of a raw document into a set of filter events.
trans-unit.target: This step extracts the content of a raw document into a set of filter events.

trans-unit.source: Takes: Raw document Sends: Filter events
trans-unit.target: Takes: Raw document Sends: Filter events

trans-unit.source: This step is used to take a raw document with an associated filter configuration and send the filter events down the pipeline. It basically extract the content and structure information of the input so steps that take filter events as input can be used. This step is generally the first one of the pipeline, but it can be placed after any step that sends a raw document.
trans-unit.target: This step is used to take a raw document with an associated filter configuration and send the filter events down the pipeline. It basically extract the content and structure information of the input so steps that take filter events as input can be used. This step is generally the first one of the pipeline, but it can be placed after any step that sends a raw document.

trans-unit.source: To merge back filter events into a raw document use the Filter Events to Raw Document step.
trans-unit.target: To merge back filter events into a raw document use the Filter Events to Raw Document step.

trans-unit.source: This step has no user parameters. All the parameters are provided by the calling application.
trans-unit.target: This step has no user parameters. All the parameters are provided by the calling application.
